title: oc-1719  -  [4.5 beta 3] deleting a file, then attempting to re-upload it immediately after results in "unknown error"
body:
from http://bugs.owncloud.org/thebuggenie/owncloud/issues/oc-1719

still present exactly as described. the user experience of this behaviour is really bad.


description:
i'm running owncloud 4.5 beta 3 on linux mint 13. i'm accessing it from firefox 15.

when i upload a simple text file via the web interface and then delete it, the undo dialog appears at the top of the screen as it should. however, for the sake of testing, i decided to see what would happen if i tried to re-upload the file instead. when i do so, it says "no file was uploaded. unknown error"

when i attempt to leave the page, i get a dialog that says "this page is asking you to confirm that you want to leave - data you have entered may not be saved."

there are three related errors in my firefox error console:

timestamp: 09/13/2012 10:27:16 am error: error: invalid pdf structure source file: https://lucan.ttl60.com:1337/owncloud/apps/files_pdfviewer/js/pdfjs/build/pdf.js line: 577

timestamp: 09/13/2012 10:27:32 am warning: expected number or percentage in rgb() but found 'na n'. error in parsing value for 'color'. declaration dropped. source file: https://lucan.ttl60.com:1337/owncloud/?app=files line: 0

timestamp: 09/13/2012 10:27:33 am error: error: invalid pdf structure source file: https://lucan.ttl60.com:1337/owncloud/apps/files_pdfviewer/js/pdfjs/build/pdf.js line: 577

interestingly enough, if i try to upload the text file a second time, it works just fine. but every time i try to upload the text file, i get that error in my firefox console about an invalid pdf structure.


reproduction steps:
1. create a simple text file and upload it to owncloud using the web interface.
2. delete the text file.
3. instead of clicking undo, try to re-upload the file again. you should see "no file was uploaded. unknown error" at the top of the screen.

#2 comment posted by blizzz sep 26, 14:33
i can confim the issue with current master.
